summary.para: Provides API that supports synchronization between the Scheduler and Google Calendars.
Provides properties that allow you to choose whether a Scheduler Appointment should be copied into a related Google Calendar Event, or vice versa. See the event description for the details.

member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.ConflictDetectedEventArgs.Appointment

summary.para: Provides access to a Scheduler Appointment associated with this conflict.

member.value: The Appointment associated with this conflict.

member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.ConflictDetectedEventArgs.ConflictOperationType

summary.para: Returns the conflict type. Allows you to determine whether the conflict has emerged for a newly created or an edited Event/Appointment.

member.value: A enumeration value that specifies the conflict type.

member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.ConflictDetectedEventArgs.Event

summary.para: Provides access to a Google Event associated with this conflict.

member.value: A Google Event associated with this conflict.

member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.ConflictDetectedEventArgs.GoogleEventIsValid

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the should copy a Google Event data into a Scheduler Appointment.

member.value: true if the should copy a Google Event data into a Scheduler Appointment; false if Appointment data should be copied into an Event.

summary.para: Provides values that allow you to get whether an Appointment associated with a synchronization conflict is a new Appointment, or an existing one that has been edited.
A conflict has occurred for an edited Event/Appointment.
A conflict has occurred for a newly created Event/Appointment.
A component that provides synchronization between a and a Google Calendar. See Google Calendars for more details.
Initializes a new instance of the class with the default settings.

summary.para: Gets or sets the CalendarListEntry.ID property of a Google Calendar, whose events should be synchronized with Scheduler Appointments.

member.name: P:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.DXGoogleCalendarSync.CalendarService

summary.para: Gets or sets a Google Calendar Service required to access Google Events.

member.value: A Google Calendar Service object required to access and modify Google Calendar Events.

summary.para: Allows you to manually compare a Google Event with its paired Scheduler Appointment, and decide whether these objects are equal.
Raises when the component is uncertain whether it should copy Scheduler Appointment data to a corresponding Google Event, or vice versa.

member.value: A String value that is the custom field name.

summary.para: Raises when the should copy Google Calendar Event data into a corresponding Scheduler Appointment.
Allows you to skip certain Scheduler Appointments and\or Google Calendar Events during synchronization.
Loads the session info from a default .xml file in the project's working directory.

summary.para: Loads the session information from the target stream.

summary.para: Saves the session info from the .xml file.

summary.para: Raises when a critical synchronization error occurs.
Repeatedly occurs as the synchronization process makes noticeable progress. Allows you to track the progress and update UI elements (e.g., a accordingly).
Saves the current session info to a default .xml file in the project's working directory.

summary.para: Triggers the synchronization.

member.name: M:DevExpress.XtraScheduler.GoogleCalendar.DXGoogleCalendarSync.SynchronizeAsync

summary.para: Triggers the synchronization. This is the asynchronous method that retrieves Google Calendar data in a non-UI thread.

member.returns: A Task that encapsulates information about the current synchronization process state.

summary.para: The automatically logs user activity and writes session information to an .xml file located in the working directory. You can call the / method overloads with no parameters to trigger this process. Alternatively, use method overloads which take the "Stream" parameter to save session info elsewhere.
The does not automatically log user activity. If needed, you can call parameterized / method overloads to manually save session information.
